node.title: 'I fully accepted the fact that I was going to lose my foot': UK teen survives croc attack in Zambia
node.description: Amelie Osborn-Smith, 19, says she is "very lucky" to have survived after a crocodile pulled her into a death roll while she was swimming in the Zambezi River during a whitewater rafting trip.
node.content:
["A British teenager who was badly injured when a crocodile bit her leg and tried to drag her underwater in Livingstone, Zambia, has said she was \"very lucky\" to have survived the attack.", "Amelie Osborn-Smith was evacuated by helicopter to Medland Hospital in Zambia's capital Lusaka\u00a0where she underwent surgical procedures.", "In her first interview after\u00a0the attack, Ms Osborn-Smith said she had \"accepted\" that she might lose her foot after being taken to hospital and was \"so relieved\" when she woke up to find that doctors had been able to save it.", "\"When the accident happened, I fully accepted the fact that I was going to lose my foot, and I accepted that, and I had said to my friends,\u00a0'It's fine. I have lost my foot. I'm still alive', and then I was told that my foot was going to be fine and that I will be able to walk again, and it's just such a relief,\" she said.", "According to British media, the teenager from Hampshire has been on a gap year visiting Zambia, where her grandmother owns a farm.", "She had been swimming in the Zambezi River with friends on a white-water rafting trip when the reptile pulled her into a death roll.", "\"Like, you don't really think in that situation,\" Ms Osborn-Smith\u00a0said.", "\"Obviously, people say, like, 'You see your life flash through your eyes', but you don't.", "\"You just think, like, 'How do I get out of this situation?' And your brain just goes into overdrive and you just think how to get out. But I was just very, very lucky,\" she said.", "", "
The teen was on a whitewater rafting trip at\u00a0Livingstone, Zambia, near the famous Victoria Falls.(Wikimedia Commons: Diego Delso)
", "British media reported that Ms Osborn-Smith's\u00a0friends rescued her by punching the crocodile and getting her to safety.", "Ms Osborn-Smith said she hoped her incident would not put people off visiting new areas.", "\"Don't let an incident like this put you off because it doesn't happen often and I was very lucky \u2026\u00a0I think, especially now, I've just seen that your life can be over so quickly,\" she said.", "\"So, if you're going to live thinking \u2026 'I'm going to regret everything', you're never going to have a fulfilled life. So I just think, just do it all while you can and don't let one incident hold you back.\"\u00a0", "AP"]
